question: who was the leader of the soviet union when the berlin wall was built
api_result: The leader of the Soviet Union when the Berlin Wall was built in 1961 was Nikita Khrushchev. He served as the First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1953 to 1964 and was a key figure during the Cold War. The Berlin Wall was erected on August 13, 1961, to prevent East Germans from fleeing to West Berlin and, by extension, to West Germany.
